result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy M Schulenberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must be completed within 90 days.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 17 days jail credit if revoked.

Defendant Troy M Schulenberg in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend to misdemeanor 961.41(3g)(d). Court grants amendment. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Defendant pleads guilty to amended charge. Court finds Defendant guilty. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement.

Court relates and orders: 
SW
1 yr Probation. To report within 24 hours.
17 days jail credit if revoked.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. To be done within 90 days.
Court costs including DNA surcharge.      
Bond to be applied.

06/06/2014 THIS BOND IS MODIFIED FROM A SIGNATURE BOND TO A $1,000.00 CASH BOND WITH THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must have no contact with the Benjamin House.
